name: XOR-distance
statement: You are given integers $$$a$$$, $$$b$$$, $$$r$$$. Find the smallest value of $$$|({a \oplus x}) - ({b \oplus x})|$$$ among all $$$0 \leq x \leq r$$$. $$$\oplus$$$ is the operation of bitwise XOR , and $$$|y|$$$ is absolute value of $$$y$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$) — the number of test cases. Each test case contains integers $$$a$$$, $$$b$$$, $$$r$$$ ($$$0 \le a, b, r \le 10^{18}$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, output a single number — the smallest possible value.
